drawingStandards.description: CAD standards for architectural drawings - defines how building elements are tagged and visually represented

scale.description: 1 meter = 100 pixels in all SVG drawings

wall-exterior.semanticMeaning: Forms the building boundary between conditioned interior and exterior environment
wall-exterior.vocabulary: EXTERIOR wall, perimeter wall, envelope wall, structural wall

wall-interior.description: Interior partition walls - non-structural room dividers
wall-interior.semanticMeaning: Divides interior space into rooms but does not define building envelope
wall-interior.vocabulary: INTERIOR wall, partition wall, non-structural wall, room divider

window.semanticMeaning: Glazed opening providing light and views

door.notes: Show swing arc to indicate door operation direction

beam.vocabulary: structural beam, loft beam, load-bearing beam

suspended-ceiling.description: Suspended ceiling hung from structural beam above
suspended-ceiling.semanticMeaning: Non-structural ceiling plane suspended below the structural beam at eave level
suspended-ceiling.vocabulary: suspended ceiling, drop ceiling, false ceiling
suspended-ceiling.notes: Hung from structural beam at eave level, creates lower ceiling height below beam

insulated-ceiling.description: Insulated cathedral ceiling attached to underside of roof
insulated-ceiling.semanticMeaning: Ceiling board with insulation attached directly to roof structure, following roof slope
insulated-ceiling.vocabulary: cathedral ceiling, insulated ceiling, vaulted ceiling
insulated-ceiling.notes: Follows roof slope, includes insulation layer between roof and ceiling board

roof.description: Roof structure and covering - top of building envelope
roof.semanticMeaning: Forms the top boundary of the building envelope between conditioned interior and exterior environment
roof.vocabulary: roof envelope, building envelope top, weather barrier

foundation.description: Foundation and slab elements - bottom of building envelope
foundation.semanticMeaning: Forms the bottom boundary of the building envelope between conditioned interior and ground/exterior environment
foundation.vocabulary: foundation envelope, building envelope bottom, slab, weather barrier

section-cut.description: Section cut line indicating where a section view is taken
section-cut.semanticMeaning: Shows the location and direction of a section view - where the building is 'cut' to show internal vertical relationships
section-cut.notes: Section cut lines must have: (1) dashed line showing cut location, (2) arrows indicating view direction, (3) label identifying the section (e.g., 'SECTION A-A')

section-arrow.description: Arrow markers showing section view direction
section-arrow.semanticMeaning: Indicates the direction from which the section is viewed

furniture.description: Furniture elements shown for context and scale
furniture.semanticMeaning: Non-structural furnishings that show how spaces will be used
furniture.notes: Used to show spatial context - beds, tables, chairs, etc.

human-scale.description: Human figure shown for scale reference
human-scale.semanticMeaning: Scale reference showing typical human dimensions (1.7m standing height)
human-scale.notes: Stick figure or simple representation - helps viewers understand scale of spaces

designVocabulary.description: Common terms for discussing the design

terms.envelope: The complete building boundary separating conditioned interior from exterior environment - includes exterior walls (vertical envelope), roof (top envelope), and foundation (bottom envelope)
terms.perimeter: The outer boundary of the building footprint
terms.loadPath: Route that structural loads travel from roof to foundation
terms.structural: Element that carries loads and cannot be removed
terms.non-structural: Element that can be removed without affecting building stability
